N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 620.8 - Approval of a certificate of incorporation or certificate of amendment

State Regulations
(a) All
corporations that intend to provide services under the auspices of OPWDD, and
for which this Part is applicable, shall hold a certificate of incorporation
attesting to their authorization to deliver specified services to persons with
developmental disabilities. (b) No
application for approval of a certificate of incorporation or certificate of
amendment will be approved unless: (1)
the
appropriate certification of need application has been submitted; (2)
the application, reviews, and proposed
certificate show: (i) compliance with all
legal requirements applicable to the corporation or proposed
corporation; (ii)
compliance with
applicable regulations of the commissioner; and
(iii)
the members of the broad of directors, officers, owners, partners and stockholders are of such character, experience, competence and standing as to give reasonable assurance of their ability to
conduct the affairs of the program in the public interest and so as to provide
proper care for the persons to be served by the proposed facility or program; and
(3)
with respect to
projects subject to OPWDD's jurisdiction, the commissioner may approve a
certificate of incorporation or certificate of amendment of a certificate of
incorporation prior to the completion of any of the procedures required in this

Part if he or she is satisfied that the requirements will be fulfilled prior to
the grant of any State aid. Notes
